page.title: 03BIRDLIFE AT MARSDEN.
page.content: Birdlife at Marsden. Over 4000 pairs of KITTIWAKES breed on the cliffs and stack at Marsden. They nest on most of the cliff edges. About 100 pairs of FULMAR nest on the cliffs among the kittiwakes. On top of Marsden Rock are the CORMORANTS, these mainly black birds are relatively uncommon in England _ the North East coast is an important breeding area for them. HERRING GULLS exist quite happily among the kittiwakes,too. Other sea birds visiting Marsden are GUILLEMOTS, RAZORBILLS and TERNS although they do not breed here.
